span.p: Disk Array Enclosures (DAEs) are at the heart of data storage processing. They provide 4Gb/s Fibre Channel connectivity to Back End I/O Modules in the engine or other DAEs and to drive loops in the DAE enclosures. DAE’s can be connected directly to the engine or daisy-chained to other DAEs.

DAEs are available as standard, 15-drive DAE, or as high density, 25-drive DAE types. The high density DAEs can house only 2.5” drives while the standard DAEs can accommodate both, 2.5” and 3.5” drives.
DAEs include the following main components:

ul.li: A maximum of 15 or 25 drives per enclosure, depending on the DAE type
Two redundant DAE power supply/cooling modules (accessible from the rear)
Two link control cards (LCCs) (accessible from the rear) that provide the drive bypass and the Fibre Channel loop failover functionality.
DAE’s can be connected directly to the engine or daisy-chained to other DAEs.
